description.narrative: The Project's main development impacts include: -Supporting growth and operations of a competitive domestic player in the oilseed crushing industry, one of the most important sectors in the Argentine economy, with positive impacts through the entire supply chain. -Enhancing port infrastructure in Argentina, one of the key drivers to improve logistics and competitiveness of the soybean supply chain. -Reaching up to 8,500 additional soybean and grain farmers who are expected to benefit from improved market access through the Company. Sourcing from farmers is being carried out by the Sponsors through the commodity exchange and the services of aggregators.

table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } Renova S.A. ("Renova" or the "Company) owns a soybean crushing and port facility in Timbues, Santa Fe, with a crushing capacity of 20,000 tons/day. The Company also owns a biodiesel facility in San Lorenzo with a processing capacity of 480,000 tons/year. The proposed project will support the construction of a third soybean crushing line with capacity of 10,000 ton/day, a new grain port with loading capacity of 4,000 tons/hour and a barges port with a capacity of 9,000 ton/day, among others (the "Project").

mailing-address.narrative: Renova S.A. +54-3476-686900 gsuarez@renova.com.ar Av. Brigadier Lopez 10500, Timbues C.P. 2207, Argentina
